newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks nudge lower in London trading.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks nudge lower in London trading.

text.p: Hong Kong shares edged lower in London trading on Friday, with investors reluctant to chase prices higher after recent strong gains in Hong Kong and market-makers squaring positions before the long bank holiday weekend in the UK and United States, dealers said.
The Hang Seng London Reference Index eased 9.26 points or 0.06 percent to 14,322.42, after the Hang Seng rose 119.68 points or 0.84 percent to a record 14,331.68.
Blue chip banking group HSBC Holdings closed down HK$0.50 at HK$222.50, after the stock climbed HK$3.00 in Hong Kong, and other leading shares were mixed around their Hong Kong close, dealers said.
"We have not seen a lot today, people have just been flattening their books ahead of the long weekend," said one dealer in Hong Kong stocks here.
